title: CNAB1 Bundle Descriptor
description: Cloud Native Application - Core version 1 - Bundle Descriptor

schemaVersion.description: The version of the CNAB specification. This should always be the integer 1 for this schema version.

version.description: A SemVer2 version for this bundle

description.description: A description of this bundle, intended for users

keywords.description: A list of keywords describing the bundle, intended for users

maintainers.description: A list of parties responsible for this bundle, with contact info

items.description: An object that describes a maintainer

name.description: Name of party reponsible for this bundle

url.description: URL of the responsible party, perhaps containing additional contact info

license.description: The SPDX license code or proprietary license name for this bundle

invocationImages.description: The array of invocation image definitions for this bundle

images.description: The array of application images installed by this bundle

credentials.description: Credentials to be injected into the invocation image

actions.description: Custom actions that can be triggered on this bundle, action name should be namespaced and use reverse DNS notation

modifies.description: Must be set to true if the action can change any resource managed by this bundle

description.description: A description of the purpose of this action

stateless.description: Indicates that the action is purely informational, that credentials are not required, and that the runtime should not keep track of its invocation

parameters.description: Parameters that can be injected into the invocation image

invocationImage.description: A bootstrapping image for the CNAB bundle.

image.description: A resolvable reference to the image. This may be interpreted differently based on imageType, but the default is to treat this as an OCI image

imageType.description: The type of image. If this is not specified, 'oci' is assumed

digest.description: A cryptographic hash digest that can be used to validate the image. This may be interpreted differently based on imageType

architecture.description: The architecture of the image (i386, amd64, arm32, arm64,...)

os.description: The operating system of the image (linux, windows, darwin,...)

mediaType.description: The media type of the image

image.description: An application image for this CNAB bundle

description.description: A description of the purpose of this image

image.description: A resolvable reference to the image. This may be interpreted differently based on imageType, but the default is to treat this as an OCI image

imageType.description: The type of image. If this is not specified, 'oci' is assumed

digest.description: A cryptographic hash digest that can be used to validate the image. This may be interpreted differently based on imageType

architecture.description: The architecture of the image (i386, amd64, arm32, arm64,...)

os.description: The operating system of the image (linux, windows, darwin,...)

mediaType.description: The media type of the image

refs.description: The locations in the invocation image that reference this image. Used for rewriting

path.description: The path in the CNAB bundle to a file that references this image. It will be calculated from the root of the container

field.description: The field to be replaced in the file specified by the 'path' property

mediaType.description: The MIME type of the file, used for determining how to process it

credential.description: Credential defines a particular credential, and where it should be placed in the invocation image

path.description: The path inside of the invocation image where credentials will be mounted

env.description: The environment variable name, such as MY_VALUE, into which the credential will be placed

description.description: A user-friendly description of this credential

parameter.description: A paramter that can be passed into the invocation image

type.description: The data type of the parameter

required.description: If true, this parameter must be supplied

defaultValue.description: The default value of this parameter

allowedValues.description: An optional exhaustive list of allowed values

minValue.description: Minimum integer value (ignored for non-integer parameters)

maxValue.description: Maximum integer value (ignored for non-integer parameters)

minLength.description: Minimum string length (ignored for non-string parameters)

maxLength.description: Maximum string length (ignored for non-string parameters)

path.description: The path inside of the invocation image where parameter data is mounted

env.description: The environment variable name, such as MY_VALUE, in which the parameter value is stored

description.description: A user-friendly description of this parameter
